intro: [WRONG START] Pedilochochilus petrophilus, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a species of orchid native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found growing on rocky substrates. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, with intricate patterns on the petals. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is adapted to thrive in high-altitude, nutrient-poor environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
